verses.verse: For He has (Ps. 89:11) founded it upon the seas, And established it upon the waters.
(Ps. 15:1-5) Who may ascend into the hill of the LORD? Or who may stand in His holy place?
He who has ((Job 17:9); Ps. 26:6) clean hands and (Ps. 51:10; 73:1; (Matt. 5:8)) a pure heart, Who has not lifted up his soul to an idol, Nor (Ps. 15:4) sworn deceitfully.
He shall receive blessing from the LORD, And righteousness from the God of his salvation.
This is Jacob, the generation of those who (Ps. 27:4, 8) seek Him, Who seek Your face. Selah
(Ps. 118:20; Is. 26:2) Lift up your heads, O you gates! And be lifted up, you everlasting doors! (Ps. 29:2, 9; 97:6; Hag. 2:7; Acts 7:2; (1 Cor. 2:8)) And the King of glory shall come in.
Who is this King of glory? The LORD strong and mighty, The LORD mighty in (Rev. 19:13-16) battle.
Lift up your heads, O you gates! Lift up, you everlasting doors! And the King of glory shall come in.
Who is this King of glory? The LORD of hosts, He is the King of glory. Selah
A Plea for Deliverance and Forgiveness A Psalm of David. ([1]) To You, O LORD, I lift up my soul.
O my God, I (Ps. 34:8) trust in You; Let me not be ashamed; (Ps. 13:4; 41:11) Let not my enemies triumph over me.
Indeed, let no one who waits on You be ashamed; Let those be ashamed who deal treacherously without cause.
(Ex. 33:13; Ps. 5:8; 27:11; 86:11; 119:27; 143:8) Show me Your ways, O LORD; Teach me Your paths.
Lead me in Your truth and teach me, For You are the God of my salvation; On You I wait all the day.
Remember, O LORD, (Ps. 103:17; 106:1) Your tender mercies and Your lovingkindnesses, For they are from of old.
Do not remember (Job 13:26; (Jer. 3:25)) the sins of my youth, nor my transgressions; (Ps. 51:1) According to Your mercy remember me, For Your goodness’ sake, O LORD.
Good and upright is the LORD; Therefore He teaches sinners in the way.
The humble He guides in justice, And the humble He teaches His way.
All the paths of the LORD are mercy and truth, To such as keep His covenant and His testimonies.
(Ps. 31:3; 79:9; 109:21; 143:11) For Your name’s sake, O LORD, Pardon my iniquity, for it is great.
Who is the man that fears the LORD? ((Ps. 25:8; 37:23)) Him shall He teach in the way He chooses.
((Prov. 19:23)) He himself shall dwell in prosperity, And (Ps. 37:11; 69:36; Matt. 5:5) his descendants shall inherit the earth.
